comments.body: As this is added in top-level arguments please add `removed_in_version=2.9`
We could also not add them here? That seems more reasonable than adding them only to almost immediately take them away.

`config replace <filename>` command works different on nxos than other platforms. Here replace has to be the path to the file instead of an option like config or block blah blah.
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/modules/network/nxos/nxos_config.py#L308
Instead of taking this in load_config, we should leave it in the module nxos_config itself and use `replace_src` param there instead of `replace`.

Agreed, that is what is mentioned in api documentation for replace parameter
```
+        :param replace: If the value is True/False it indicates if running configuration should be completely
+                        replace by candidate configuration. If can also take configuration file path as value,
+                        the file in this case should be present on the remote host in the mentioned path as a
+                        prerequisite.
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +382,386 @@        """
        if replace:
            commands = 'config replace {0}'.format(replace)

        commands = to_list(commands)

comments.body:
we should not be adding a python dependency on ordereddict here, as python2.7 can also use ordereddict from collections:

  https://docs.python.org/2/library/collections.html#collections.OrderedDict

This also means, that python2.7 users now need an additional python dependency installed.
@pabelanger Thanks for the feedback. I'll tighten up the `ordereddict` import to pre-2.7.
this isn't needed, as ordereddict from pypi only supports python2.4 - python2.6
